artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 269; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 295.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; overhead roofless view of a large building with many rooms; group of men and women dining with woman playing shamisen in LLC; another group of dingers in ULC with three women in elaborate colorful kimonos; man in yellow checked kimono at center accompanied by two women; male servant in blue checked kimono at right with a lantern and a low table with plates of food; two women and a man dining at top center
dimension: 14 1/2 × 10 in. (36.83 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: L, R: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu} | C: 一魁斎芳年写 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi sha}
title: Complete View of a Courtesan House in Tokyo
